conclusion: When the switch is at position 1 the only external resistance in the circuit is R₁.
The source of e.m.f. E delivers a current I₁ = E / (R₁ + r).
The voltmeter is ideal with infinite resistance and is connected across the source.
The voltmeter reads the terminal voltage V₁ = E − I₁ r = 1 V.
When the switch is at position 2 the external resistance is R₂.
The source of e.m.f. E delivers a current I₂ = E / (R₂ + r).
The terminal voltage is now V₂ = E − I₂ r = 1.5 V.
Substitute R₁ = 0.5 Ω, R₂ = 1.5 Ω and the two voltmeter readings V₁, V₂ into the equations.
The resulting simultaneous equations in E and r are solved to obtain E = 2.0 V and r = 0.5 Ω.
Electromotive force of the source E = 2.0 V and internal resistance of the source r = 0.50 Ω.
